resumo: "Great Men and Famous Women. Vol. 1" by Charles F. Horne is a historical anthology written in the late 19th century. The anthology aims to shed light on the achievements and impacts of these individuals, making it both educational and engaging for readers interested in history. The opening portion highlights the conquests and actions of Nebuchadnezzar, showcasing his ascent to power, military campaigns, and the subsequent fall of Jerusalem to his forces.
